oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Characterization of CYP450 mediated metabolism of the polymorphic CYP2D6 probe drug codeine in horses
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gretler, Sophie R.
Baden, Russell
McKemie, Daniel S.
Knych, Heather K.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Cytochrome P450
codeine
horse
probe drug
metabolism
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cytochrome P450s are an important family of enzymes that metabolize both endogenous substrates as well as many therapeutic drugs and xenobiotics. Knowledge of P450 mediated drug metabolism is vital to establishing safe and effective dosing regimens, especially those involving multiple drugs.  Identification and characterization of equine P450s, with respect to their involvement in drug metabolism, is still very much in its infancy.  This study aims to build on the limited current knowledge regarding P450 mediated metabolism in horses by describing the metabolism of codeine in vitro.
